AD_RefugeeChild_001.synopsis: Behaviour AD for Molly, the orphan child. Daughter of Jacek, that dies in Act 1. This

Devella_Dead_31.speaker: Narrator
Devella_Dead_31.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Devella_Dead_28.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Devella_Dead_28.text: Devella Fountainhead... Constable of... the Flaming Fist...

Devella_Dead_36.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Devella_Dead_36.text: A century ago... a Bhaalspawn ruled... the Iron Throne...

Devella_Dead_10.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Devella_Dead_10.text: He fell... but that was not the end...

Devella_Dead_25.speaker: Player
Devella_Dead_25.text: How do you know the Bhaalists are back?

Devella_Dead_35.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Devella_Dead_35.text: He wanted Figaro's hand... for tribunal of Bhaal...

Devella_Dead_3.speaker: Player
Devella_Dead_3.text: What is the purpose of this tribunal?

Devella_Dead_8.speaker: Narrator
Devella_Dead_8.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Devella_Dead_15.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Devella_Dead_15.context: InternalNodeContext: This can be generic, not adressing if players kill figaro or if Dolor kills Figaro.

Devella_Dead_38.speaker: Narrator
Devella_Dead_38.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Devella_Dead_39.speaker: Narrator
Devella_Dead_39.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

WineFestivalCivilian001_0.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
WineFestivalCivilian001_0.text: Why, I think I should 'sample' several more glasses, don't you agree?

WineFestivalCivilian001_1.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
WineFestivalCivilian001_1.text: Terrible shame what happened to that halfling couple... Did you chat to them? They were lovely.

WineFestivalCivilian001_2.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
WineFestivalCivilian001_2.text: You know they're just giving out free wine here? Calling it a 'sample' - very cosmopolitan.

WineFestivalCivilian001_3.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
WineFestivalCivilian001_3.text: I just don't get it - why would anyone want to hurt such nice people?

WineFestivalCivilian001_4.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
WineFestivalCivilian001_4.text: Did you see that horrible man run away? Shouting about sacrifices... Definitely had one too many. Not like me.

AD_RefugeeChild_002_0.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
AD_RefugeeChild_002_0.text: I don't know why they like wine so much. It's icky.

AD_RefugeeChild_002_1.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
AD_RefugeeChild_002_1.text: I bet Cora could make mum's apple pie if I find a recipe...

AD_RefugeeChild_002_2.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
AD_RefugeeChild_002_2.text: I'm not ready to go back on the streets... It's cold...

AD_RefugeeChild_002_3.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
AD_RefugeeChild_002_3.text: Cora's not going anywhere, is she? She can't.

AD_RogerHighberry_Mourning_0.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_Mourning_0.context: NodeContext: his wife has just died

AD_DolorBeingAttackedRunAwayCantEscape_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_DolorBeingAttackedRunAwayCantEscape_0.text: I will tear the beating heart from your chest.

AD_DolorBeingAttackedFigaro_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_DolorBeingAttackedFigaro_0.text: Another witness to my sacrament. How fortunate.

Doppelganger_002_0.speaker: Rigg
Doppelganger_002_0.text: I don't know about you, but I think some of these folk might be drunkards.

Doppelganger_002_1.speaker: Rigg
Doppelganger_002_1.text: I'm rather enjoying the white - maybe you should give it a try.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_0.text: My name is Meztli, and you must be...?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_6.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_6.text: I'm Roger Highberry, and this is my darling wife, Cora.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_3.speaker: Meztli
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_3.text: Mr Highberry, you're a lucky man.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_4.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_4.text: Hah, quite right! And please, call me Roger. I do abhor formality.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_12.speaker: Cora Highberry
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_12.text: Oh Master Meztli, you are a charmer!

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_7.speaker: Meztli
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_7.text: My, what a handsome couple you make! May I interest you both in a tasting?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_14.speaker: Cora Highberry
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_14.text: Gosh - I must say, flattery will get you everywhere!

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_8.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_8.text: It's certainly worked for me over the last few decades, my love!

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_9.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_9.text: So, how much will this tasting session lighten my coinpurse?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_1.speaker: Meztli
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_1.text: Your money is no good here. If I charged such a charming couple for enjoying good wine...

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_5.speaker: Meztli
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_5.text: Well, Lliira herself would smite me where I stood.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_11.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_11.text: You are far too generous, Master Meztli. You must allow us some way to reimburse you.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_13.speaker: Cora Highberry
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_13.text: I won't hear of it. Your conversation is payment enough.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_2.speaker: Cora Highberry
AD_WineFestivalChatter_005_2.text: Well, Roger, he is the expert, who are we to quibble over cost?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_4.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_4.text: Are you enjoying the festival so far?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_10.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_10.text: Well, I'm glad! It really wasn't easy to set it all up myself.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_2.speaker: Aran Elomar
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_2.text: Yes, you've made that very clear.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_6.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_6.text: I can get you both some free wine if you'd like.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_11.speaker: Gorrka Bekoone
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_11.text: They're called free samples. We can all get some.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_12.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_12.text: Now, did I mention that I set this entire festival up myself?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_19.speaker: Aran Elomar
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_19.text: How... fascinating. Now, I must say, this vintage is -

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_16.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_16.text: These barrels aren't light, I'll tell you that for free.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_13.speaker: Aran Elomar
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_13.text: Look, I'm just glad no one got hurt.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_17.speaker: Gorrka Bekoone
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_17.text: Yes, I suppose the mental harm to that poor old woman would be -

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_15.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_15.text: No, I mean our business is absolutely ruined.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_18.speaker: Aran Elomar
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_18.text: I must say, you're being rather selfish, making this all about you.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_27.speaker: Gorrka Bekoone
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_27.text: Indeed, that poor halfling couple nearly died!

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_20.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_20.text: I'm just worried about myself - I don't see anything wrong with that.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_21.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_21.text: Do you reckon they'll pay us extra after this terrible scare?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_22.speaker: Gorrka Bekoone
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_22.text: I suppose they might... Hang on.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_25.speaker: Aran Elomar
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_25.text: If they didn't sell anything, how can they pay more?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_24.speaker: Aran Elomar
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_24.text: Say, if you set this up, you probably know the best wine here, right?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_23.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_23.text: Who - me? 'Fraid not - I'm a cider man myself.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_26.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_26.text: I'll tell you for free, I've never seen anything like this in all my career as a festival worker.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_3.speaker: Aran Elomar
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_3.text: And how long has that career been exactly?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_9.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_9.text: I think one's work ethic is far more important than career length, don't you?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_1.speaker: Gorrka Bekoone
AD_WineFestivalChatter_004_1.text: It's insane you're talking about this. Someone has died.

AD_WineFestivalCivilian002_0.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
AD_WineFestivalCivilian002_0.text: The corpses were mutilated. Did anyone see?

AD_WineFestivalCivilian002_1.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
AD_WineFestivalCivilian002_1.text: How horrific... Cora was always so joyful.

SwD_AlexanderRainforest_28.speaker: Narrator
SwD_AlexanderRainforest_28.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

SwD_AlexanderRainforest_36.speaker: Alexander Rainforest
SwD_AlexanderRainforest_36.text: He was... short... Dressed... in red...

SwD_AlexanderRainforest_3.speaker: Player
SwD_AlexanderRainforest_3.text: What were you doing when you died?

SwD_AlexanderRainforest_4.speaker: Alexander Rainforest
SwD_AlexanderRainforest_4.text: Tombstone... shop... No owner... Decades now...

SwD_AlexanderRainforest_19.speaker: Player
SwD_AlexanderRainforest_19.text: What in the hells is an ombudsman?

SwD_AlexanderRainforest_7.speaker: Narrator
SwD_AlexanderRainforest_7.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

SwD_AlexanderRainforest_34.speaker: Narrator
SwD_AlexanderRainforest_34.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Doppelganger_003_0.speaker: Podd
Doppelganger_003_0.text: Excuse me, your unwashed stink is putting me off my wine.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_5.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_5.text: Another kill. Your technique is improving... Very novel, I must say.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_26.speaker: Narrator
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_26.text: *The creature fixes you with an eerie gaze. It doesn't just see you, it sees through you.*
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: The doppelganger look at the player and smiles with horrible, knowing malice.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_15.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_15.text: Tear the hand from the corpse you have made in Bhaal's name.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_23.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_23.text: Then enter Candulhallow's Tombstones. Announce your intention - to become an Unholy Assassin. A vessel for Lord Bhaal.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_14.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_14.text: There you shall be judged. There you shall transcend.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_17.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_17.text: Approach - unique. Form - sloppy. But the passion for killing - like a game. It's a shame I was the only acolyte here to witness you.
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: The doppelganger should have a maniac smile in his face.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_13.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_13.text: Would you like to be more than a common murderer? To become an avatar of slaughter?

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_6.speaker: Player
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_6.text: Tell me what I must do.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_24.speaker: Lae'zel
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_24.text: Chk - I know the thirst for blood. But you must kill with purpose, not for its own sake.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_12.speaker: Shadowheart
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_12.text: Sounds like random butchery. If I kill, it has to be with purpose.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_4.speaker: Astarion
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_4.text: Look at you. An 'Avatar of Slaughter', indeed.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_16.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_16.text: Another life must be claimed in the name of our Lord. Choose wisely from this list.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_19.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_19.text: We will meet again, aspirant. Hopefully in the most auspicious of circumstance.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_31.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_31.text: You must kill again - but I don't imagine that'll be a problem. End another target from this list.
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: He gave us a copy of the target list of future victims.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_11.speaker: Wyll
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_11.text: Don't you dare think of giving in. If you're so keen to hunt, we'll find deserving prey.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_28.speaker: Gale
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_28.text: I'd no idea you held such aspirations. Can't say I share them.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_18.speaker: Karlach
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_18.text: Hang on - you're not seriously considering this, are you?

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_30.speaker: Halsin
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_30.text: Unnatural wickedness. Take no part in this, please.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_20.speaker: Jaheira
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_20.text: Turn around, and walk the other way.
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_20.context: NodeContext: Flat warning - player has been approached by a creepy stranger asking if we want to become 'an avatar of slaughter'. Player asked stranger what they must do, but Jaheira butts in to respond bluntly.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_21.speaker: Minsc
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_21.text: This one's smile distresses Boo. If it is slaughter he wants, I will give it to him directly.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_10.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_10.text: It is good to meet somebody who recognises our talents - better still if they reward us for doing what comes naturally.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_8.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_8.text: Our gaze will remain upon you. You have great... potential.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_3.speaker: Player
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_3.text: Sure thing - last time I got an invitation like this, life got a lot more interesting.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_25.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_25.text: A most fitting demise for a most irksome thorn.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_2.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_2.text: The good constable may have had the wherewithal to stop us. It brings me great pleasure to speak of her in the past tense.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_22.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_22.text: Such a penchant for violence... It makes me wonder.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_9.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_Backup_9.text: Valeria was an incompetent... but having a celestial meddle in our affairs proved most disquieting.

RogerWineFestival_1.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_1.text: Oho! How wonderful - young folk seldom attend these shindigs. It's a shame my Cora isn't here - she'd be delighted.

RogerWineFestival_22.speaker: Player
RogerWineFestival_22.text: It is a shame - I'm sorry for your loss.

RogerWineFestival_8.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_8.text: My loss? Oh, gosh, no! I must watch my turns of phrase. My Cora isn't dead, she's simply unwell.

RogerWineFestival_4.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_4.text: Did you see all those people? They... they changed! Hold on, Cora! CORA!

RogerWineFestival_23.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_23.text: Gods... Poor Cora... How could this happen?

RogerWineFestival_31.speaker: Player
RogerWineFestival_31.text: She's on this list of targets a serial killer has been using.

RogerWineFestival_3.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_3.text: Why would anyone want to hurt my Cora? She's the kindest person I know...

RogerWineFestival_29.speaker: Player
RogerWineFestival_29.text: I think she was poisoned - did Cora drink anything at the festival that you didn't?

RogerWineFestival_6.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_6.text: I don't remember exactly... I know I only tried white and red.

RogerWineFestival_9.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_9.text: I'll stay with Cora. Please, if there's more to this, let me know.

RogerWineFestival_11.speaker: Player
RogerWineFestival_11.text: I'm chasing a killer - a dwarf dressed in red. Did Cora speak to anyone like that?

RogerWineFestival_19.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_19.text: We met two dwarves - I wasn't paying attention to their attire.

RogerWineFestival_25.speaker: Player
RogerWineFestival_25.text: Stay with Cora. I'll sort this out.

RogerWineFestival_30.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_30.text: Why would anyone do such a thing? My poor Cora...

RogerWineFestival_38.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_38.text: Ah, hello again! I must remember to tell my Cora how well attended this festival was.

RogerWineFestival_17.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_17.text: I think one of the wines disagreed with her. She came over all shaky and went upstairs to lie down.

RogerWineFestival_21.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_21.text: It's a good job the festival was right on our doorstep - at least she didn't have far to go.

RogerWineFestival_2.speaker: Player
RogerWineFestival_2.text: Cora's name is on this list of murder targets. She's in danger.

RogerWineFestival_10.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_10.text: What? Why would anyone...? Do you think she was poisoned?

RogerWineFestival_36.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_36.text: I must see to her at once!

RogerWineFestival_34.speaker: Player
RogerWineFestival_34.text: Why are you at a wine festival if your wife is sick?

RogerWineFestival_12.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_12.text: She said she'd rather I enjoyed myself here than mope around in the house. Besides, I'm no apothecary - I wouldn't be any use!

RogerWineFestival_33.speaker: Player
RogerWineFestival_33.text: What wines did she drink? I'll do my best to avoid them.

RogerWineFestival_13.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_13.text: I'm afraid you're out of luck there, friend. She had a taste of all of them.

RogerWineFestival_26.speaker: Player
RogerWineFestival_26.text: Sounds like Cora drank a bit too much.

RogerWineFestival_35.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_35.text: Well, she did try all of the wines. But only a taster of each - not enough to get squiffy.

RogerWineFestival_37.speaker: Player
RogerWineFestival_37.text: How's the festival going so far?

RogerWineFestival_28.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_28.text: I'm having a rather grand time of it, it's just a shame my better half took ill.

RogerWineFestival_24.speaker: Player
RogerWineFestival_24.text: Your wife upstairs - something's wrong with her - she's paralysed.

RogerWineFestival_39.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_39.text: What? I must see to her at once!

RogerWineFestival_15.speaker: Roger Highberry
RogerWineFestival_15.text: Yes, I believe so. Terrible shame, really.

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_0.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_0.text: 'For clothes that are pigment to last, come to Figaro Facemaker!'

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_16.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_16.text: Please start fitting customers, not slogans. You know, your job.

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_14.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_14.text: Our boss is literally dead. Surely you have to know that's not appropriate.

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_18.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_18.text: No, your boss is me now - Master Figaro said so.

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_3.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_3.text: 'Get a killer look when you shop Facemaker Fashion!'

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_17.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_17.text: That's the most tasteless slogan you've come up with yet. Great job.

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_4.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_4.text: You know, I heard it was a Bhaalist that tried to kill Master Figaro.

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_5.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_5.text: Why would a Bhaalist want Master Figaro dead?

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_12.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_12.text: Didn't like the ruffs on the new Facemaker fashion line? Who can say.

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_7.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_7.text: I... I still can't believe Master Figaro is dead.

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_15.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_15.text: I still can't believe he left you in charge of the shop.

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_8.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_8.text: How about: 'Welcome back to Figaro Facemaker - where the clothes are to dye for!'

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_9.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_9.text: Do... Do you get it? To dye for? Clothes?

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_10.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_10.text: I get the joke like one gets dysentery. Can we please get back to work?

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_11.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_11.text: 'To look all sharp like a mover and shaker, get your garbs from Figaro Facemaker!'

Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_13.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_AD_AssistantsChatting_13.text: Master Figaro isn't paying you extra to come up with slogans, you know.

AD_FlamingFist01_Yelling_0.speaker: Fist Rusk
AD_FlamingFist01_Yelling_0.text: I must insist you stay back. Constable Devella is on the case.

AD_DolorSeeYouKillCora_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_DolorSeeYouKillCora_0.text: Curious. Appears I have competition. I will see you again.

Dolor_Dead_22.speaker: Narrator
Dolor_Dead_22.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dolor_Dead_9.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Dead_9.text: Dolor... A humble servant... A most glorious aspirant...

Dolor_Dead_24.speaker: Player
Dolor_Dead_24.text: Why did you kill all those people?

Dolor_Dead_5.speaker: Narrator
Dolor_Dead_5.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Dolor_Dead_25.speaker: Narrator
Dolor_Dead_25.text: *The corpse tries to speak, but something prevents it.*

Dolor_Dead_15.speaker: Player
Dolor_Dead_15.text: How does one become an Unholy Assassin?

Dolor_Dead_0.speaker: Player
Dolor_Dead_0.text: How do I get access to the Murder Tribunal?

Dolor_Dead_20.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Dead_20.text: Speak the word at the door... Bring proof of two sacrifices...

Dolor_Dead_7.speaker: Player
Dolor_Dead_7.text: What proof will the Tribunal require?

Dolor_Dead_19.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Dead_19.text: An innocent's hand... To touch divinity...

Dolor_Dead_28.speaker: Narrator
Dolor_Dead_28.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dolor_Dead_32.speaker: Narrator
Dolor_Dead_32.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

RefugeeChild_002_8.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
RefugeeChild_002_8.text: Thank you for saving Cora - thank you thank you.

RefugeeChild_002_17.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
RefugeeChild_002_17.text: Mum will be back soon. Then I can go home.

RefugeeChild_002_18.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
RefugeeChild_002_18.text: I miss Cora. Why won't she come back?

RefugeeChild_002_10.speaker: Player
RefugeeChild_002_10.text: I prefer not to think about the past, if I'm honest.

RefugeeChild_002_3.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
RefugeeChild_002_3.text: But don't you miss your parents?

RefugeeChild_002_19.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
RefugeeChild_002_19.text: Mum made the best apple pie.

RefugeeChild_002_14.speaker: Player
RefugeeChild_002_14.text: You've got the Highberries to look after you. They seem nice.

RefugeeChild_002_4.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
RefugeeChild_002_4.text: Cora's nice. Roger's nice too, but Cora's my favourite.

RefugeeChild_002_20.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
RefugeeChild_002_20.text: She makes a really good pot roast. Don't tell anyone I said this, but I actually think it might be better than mum's...

RefugeeChild_002_2.speaker: Player
RefugeeChild_002_2.text: My friends are all the family I need - do you have friends?

RefugeeChild_002_24.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
RefugeeChild_002_24.text: Cora says it'll get better with time. She's not mum, but... she does give good hugs.

RefugeeChild_002_16.speaker: Player
RefugeeChild_002_16.text: Tough luck. There are bigger problems in this city right now.

RefugeeChild_002_23.speaker: Player
RefugeeChild_002_23.text: Don't be ridiculous. I'm an adult.

RefugeeChild_002_7.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
RefugeeChild_002_7.text: Adults have parents too! Cora said so.

RefugeeChild_002_15.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
RefugeeChild_002_15.text: I miss my parents. Especially mum.

RefugeeChild_002_21.speaker: Timmy the Orphan
RefugeeChild_002_21.text: She made the best apple pie.

WineFestivalWorker02_0.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
WineFestivalWorker02_0.text: Aha, step back, civilian. Setting up a wine festival can be dangerous.

WineFestivalWorker02_1.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
WineFestivalWorker02_1.text: This is the best job I've ever had, I must say.

WineFestivalWorker02_2.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
WineFestivalWorker02_2.text: Can you believe it? I thought this would be a civilised event.

WineFestivalWorker02_3.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
WineFestivalWorker02_3.text: Isn't this pleasant? Almost enough to take your mind off the general sense of impending doom.

WineFestivalWorker02_4.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
WineFestivalWorker02_4.text: I said wine festivals could be dangerous... Nobody believed me...

WineFestivalWorker02_5.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
WineFestivalWorker02_5.text: Welcome. I'm not really a 'wine person' myself. But free's free!

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_1.speaker: Flaerith
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_1.text: I mean... surely our wine couldn't have been poisoned?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_29.speaker: Ontur
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_29.text: Depends - did you drink the pink?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_28.speaker: Flaerith
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_28.text: I wouldn't debase myself so much.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_31.speaker: Porter Oveer
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_31.text: Did I drink the pink? Shit...

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_7.speaker: Ontur
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_7.text: Now, Flaerith - I'm just saying white wine is better.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_5.speaker: Porter Oveer
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_5.text: Best not tell them I prefer a pink.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_12.speaker: Ontur
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_12.text: At least white wine doesn't stain tongues and teeth.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_24.speaker: Flaerith
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_24.text: No, they stain their drinker's reputation instead.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_8.speaker: Flaerith
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_8.text: Has this happened to you before?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_6.speaker: Ontur
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_6.text: Oh yeah, the cheese and ale festival a few years back. Some very funky cheese.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_23.speaker: Flaerith
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_23.text: I'm talking about the murder attempt.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_17.speaker: Ontur
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_17.text: So am I. That cheese was pure poison.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_10.speaker: Flaerith
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_10.text: You know if cheese affects you that badly, there are spells for it?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_0.speaker: Porter Oveer
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_0.text: How can you talk about cheese at a time like this?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_11.speaker: Flaerith
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_11.text: This red is the best wine in the entire Sword Coast.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_4.speaker: Ontur
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_4.text: In the Sword Coast? In your dreams, more like!

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_16.speaker: Flaerith
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_16.text: You know, I really do think red is the best wine.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_26.speaker: Ontur
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_26.text: What, on a hot summer's day? Madness.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_13.speaker: Porter Oveer
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_13.text: Oooh, I bet this'll be fun.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_21.speaker: Flaerith
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_21.text: Oh, this is really awful. Truly terrible.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_25.speaker: Ontur
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_25.text: Yes... terrible. I can't believe this is happening again.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_20.speaker: Flaerith
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_20.text: Quite right, it's - wait, what do you mean 'again'?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_32.speaker: Flaerith
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_32.text: I think... I think I was too harsh, Ontur. My apologies.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_30.speaker: Ontur
AD_WineFestivalChatter_003_30.text: The only thing that's too harsh are these tannins.

Figaro_Assistant_000_1.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_Assistant_000_1.text: Hello again! If it's fashion you're after - Master Figaro's the man to see!

Figaro_Assistant_000_2.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_Assistant_000_2.text: I'm ever so glad Master Figaro was saved - I'd have been out of a job otherwise!

Figaro_Assistant_000_3.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_Assistant_000_3.text: 'Facemaker Fashion: Dress like every day could be your last!'

Figaro_Assistant_000_7.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_Assistant_000_7.text: I'm afraid Master Figaro has... passed. I am happy to help you with all your fashion needs, however.

Figaro_Assistant_000_8.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_Assistant_000_8.text: Murder. Murder most ugly. Now - can I interest you in any clothes?

Figaro_Assistant_000_6.speaker: Player
Figaro_Assistant_000_6.text: Let's see what you have to trade.

Figaro_Assistant_000_0.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_Assistant_000_0.text: Look good and walk well, friend. It's what Master Figaro would've wanted.

Figaro_Assistant_000_10.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_Assistant_000_10.text: Welcome back to Facemaker Fashion. Master Figaro may be dead - but his style lives on. While stocks last.

Figaro_Assistant_000_11.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_Assistant_000_11.text: 'Facemaker Fashion - don't just look the part, be the part.'

Figaro_Assistant_000_5.speaker: Phlanders Hort
Figaro_Assistant_000_5.text: And if you want to - uh - be the part... Um. Master Figaro still has some space between appointments. Yes.
Figaro_Assistant_000_5.context: NodeContext: is trying to stretch out a slogan more than it should be

Figaro_Doppelganger_001_0.speaker: Gujj
Figaro_Doppelganger_001_0.text: How long do you think Master Pennygood expects us to wait? I'm bored already.

Figaro_Doppelganger_001_1.speaker: Gujj
Figaro_Doppelganger_001_1.text: Hey! Wait your turn. We're all here to see Figaro, it's not just you.

AD_RogerHighberry_0.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_0.text: And a missive from the Temple. At least they remembered.

AD_RogerHighberry_1.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_1.text: To think... If someone hadn't intervened... Horrid.

AD_RogerHighberry_2.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_2.text: I'll write to the council. This cannot happen again.

AD_RogerHighberry_3.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_3.text: Goodness, so much correspondence these days.

AD_RogerHighberry_4.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_4.text: I don't do children's clothing, never mind 'donations' - that Figaro's a real miser.

AD_RogerHighberry_5.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_5.text: That's certainly the last wine festival we'll be hosting.

AD_RogerHighberry_6.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_6.text: A letter about the wine festival... Ah. No. An invoice.

AD_RogerHighberry_7.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_7.text: Dear Mr Highberry, Our condolences... Of course - the bank.

AD_RogerHighberry_8.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_8.text: Dear Cora... Hm. Open Hand Temple parchment. One for later.

AD_RogerHighberry_9.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_9.text: ...and I'll try to get off duty for the funeral. You were right, Cora. That Ephren's a kind soul.

AD_RogerHighberry_10.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_10.text: To Molly... Bless, a letter from Fist Ephren. That'll cheer her right up.

AD_RogerHighberry_11.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_11.text: Best stick to donations from now on. Much less dangerous.

AD_RogerHighberry_12.speaker: Roger Highberry
AD_RogerHighberry_12.text: Hah. You'd have liked this one, Cora. From the Alyths. You'd... you'd have liked it.

AD_DolorReceiveFirstAttackFestival_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_DolorReceiveFirstAttackFestival_0.text: Nononono... It was going to be perfect... NO!

PAD_ReadingDolorsNote_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ReadingDolorsNote_0.text: A passphrase, 'Sicarius', and a location... We should find this 'Candulhallow' place.

AD_Dolor_Threat1_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_Threat1_0.text: You are not on the Tribunal's list... So I will make your murder quick.

AD_DolorBeingAttackedRunAway_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_DolorBeingAttackedRunAway_0.text: You have spoiled my masterpiece. No matter, there are other sacrifices aplenty.

AD_CoraHighberry_0.speaker: Cora Highberry
AD_CoraHighberry_0.text: Perhaps we should look into some protection... But my word, the cost.
AD_CoraHighberry_0.context: NodeContext: muttered to herself - recently been attacked and nearly killed

AD_CoraHighberry_1.speaker: Cora Highberry
AD_CoraHighberry_1.text: Goodness... I just hope the children are safe.
AD_CoraHighberry_1.context: NodeContext: muttered to herself - recently been attacked and nearly killed

AD_CoraHighberry_2.speaker: Cora Highberry
AD_CoraHighberry_2.text: Master Meztli is confirmed... The barrels are ready...
AD_CoraHighberry_2.context: NodeContext: muttered to herself, preparing to host an event

AD_CoraHighberry_3.speaker: Cora Highberry
AD_CoraHighberry_3.text: Now where is my good hat? I wager the kids were playing dress-up again...
AD_CoraHighberry_3.context: NodeContext: muttered to herself, preparing to host an event

AD_CoraHighberry_4.speaker: Cora Highberry
AD_CoraHighberry_4.text: Goodness me, there's a lot to organise.
AD_CoraHighberry_4.context: NodeContext: muttered to herself, preparing to host an event

AD_CoraHighberry_5.speaker: Cora Highberry
AD_CoraHighberry_5.text: I still can't believe what that horrid man wanted to do.
AD_CoraHighberry_5.context: NodeContext: muttered to herself - just been attacked and nearly killed

Figaro_Assistant_001_0.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_Assistant_001_0.text: I'm afraid in the case of Master Figaro's death, the entire shop was to be entrusted to my... esteemed colleague.
Figaro_Assistant_001_0.context: NodeContext: miffed that she's not the one running the shop

Figaro_Assistant_001_5.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_Assistant_001_5.text: So if you've any fashion needs, go bother him.
Figaro_Assistant_001_5.context: NodeContext: miffed that she's not the one running the shop

Figaro_Assistant_001_1.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_Assistant_001_1.text: I think Master Figaro has a few spaces between appointments today. You're in luck!

Figaro_Assistant_001_2.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_Assistant_001_2.text: Can't believe someone would try and murder Master Figaro.

Figaro_Assistant_001_4.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_Assistant_001_4.text: He wouldn't hurt a fly. Well - unless it was buzzing around one of his fitting rooms.

Figaro_Assistant_001_3.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_Assistant_001_3.text: You're really better speaking to Master Figaro. He'll be able to find you an outfit that's just right.

Figaro_Assistant_001_6.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_Assistant_001_6.text: I'm glad Figaro's all right, though. Without him I'd have no job or dress sense.

Figaro_Assistant_001_7.speaker: Bobula Hanvers
Figaro_Assistant_001_7.text: My colleague's in charge - go bother him with any fashion queries. I've got stock to sort.
Figaro_Assistant_001_7.context: NodeContext: miffed that she's not the one running the shop

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_6.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_6.text: This is a welcome distraction from all the war talk.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_8.speaker: Dave Hosmo
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_8.text: No, we're being too lax right now.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_26.speaker: Dave Hosmo
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_26.text: Refugees, wine festivals, we're wasting our resources.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_2.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_2.text: I can't help but notice you're drinking anyway, Dave.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_4.speaker: Dave Hosmo
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_4.text: Well, if the wine's here already, I might as well drink it.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_7.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_7.text: You do get very negative after a couple of glasses.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_27.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_27.text: All I'm saying is she's old. The maniac couldn't have tried very hard.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_14.speaker: Dave Hosmo
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_14.text: Are we a bit calmer now, pal?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_1.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_1.text: Sure. I'm calm. Calm as can be. Turns out glass number five was rather soothing.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_16.speaker: Dave Hosmo
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_16.text: Quite the turnout, don't you think?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_21.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_21.text: You should've seen the cheese festival last year.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_12.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_12.text: The streets were packed. The stench was... potent.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_18.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_18.text: So you think they shouldn't bring any more wine? That right?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_0.speaker: Dave Hosmo
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_0.text: I mean, I didn't say that...

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_13.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_13.text: I wish you hadn't said anything.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_23.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_23.text: Anyway - what are we supposed to do if that bastard comes back? When will Gortash fix things?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_10.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_10.text: You saw what happened. Our lives are at risk and you're asking me to calm down?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_24.speaker: Dave Hosmo
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_24.text: I just think we shouldn't be letting our guard down.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_19.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_19.text: Why not? It's good to relax.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_20.speaker: Dave Hosmo
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_20.text: These refugees are killers, apparently. And they're everywhere.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_22.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_22.text: The only killer around here is going to be your hangover tomorrow, Dave.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_25.speaker: Dave Hosmo
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_25.text: My, that halfling lady is lucky to be here.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_11.speaker: 'Zinfandel' Gorse
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_11.text: Especially at her age. Isn't she a bit old to be cutting about a wine festival?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_28.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
AD_WineFestivalChatter_002_28.text: If she's lived to be that old in Baldur's Gate, she deserves a glass of wine or six. Lighten up.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_2.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_2.text: A marked improvement. I am... impressed, aspirant. You are ready. Claim the hands from your kills.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_26.speaker: Narrator
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_26.text: *The creature fixes you with an eerie gaze. It doesn't just see you, it sees through you.*
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: The doppelganger look at the player and smiles with horrible, knowing malice.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_17.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_17.text: Enter Candulhallow's Tombstones by speaking 'Sicarius' at the door. Announce your intention before the Tribunal - to become an Unholy Assassin.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_18.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_18.text: There you shall be judged. There you shall transcend.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_12.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_12.text: A most prickly thorn pulled from our sides...

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_6.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_6.text: The late constable would've proved very difficult to us in the future. You have my... undying gratitude.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_20.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_20.text: While a touch incompetent, Investigator Valeria could have still proved difficult.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_16.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_16.text: A bloody tapestry most excellently woven. You are ready. Claim the hands from your kills.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_31.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_31.text: The approach - unique. The form - sloppy. But the passion for killing - it was like sport. I would be remiss to ignore such talent.
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: The doppelganger should have a maniac smile in his face.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_15.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_15.text: Would you like to be more than a common murderer? To become an avatar of slaughter?

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_8.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_8.text: An ally, of sorts. If you let me, I can help you embrace your most murderous becoming.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_3.speaker: Player
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_3.text: Tell me what I must do.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_11.speaker: Lae'zel
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_11.text: Chk - I know the thirst for blood. But you must kill with purpose, not for its own sake.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_28.speaker: Shadowheart
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_28.text: Sounds like random butchery. If I kill, it has to be with purpose.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_30.speaker: Astarion
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_30.text: Look at you. An 'Avatar of Slaughter', indeed.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_21.speaker: Wyll
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_21.text: Don't you dare think of giving in. If you're so keen to hunt, we'll find deserving prey.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_29.speaker: Gale
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_29.text: I'd no idea you held such aspirations. Can't say I share them.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_10.speaker: Karlach
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_10.text: You can't be seriously considering this. You're better than this. Aren't you?

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_36.speaker: Halsin
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_36.text: Unnatural wickedness. Take no part in this, please.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_0.speaker: Jaheira
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_0.text: Turn around, and walk the other way.
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_0.context: NodeContext: Flat warning - player has been approached by a creepy stranger asking if we want to become 'an avatar of slaughter'. Player asked stranger what they must do, but Jaheira butts in to respond bluntly.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_9.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_9.text: You must kill again. Twice. Choose from our list of most unholy sacrifices.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_25.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_25.text: Remove your victims' hand. You will need it for what lies ahead. Good luck, aspirant, I trust we will meet again.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_14.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_14.text: You must kill once more. Choose from our list of most unholy sacrifices - make them whole in murder.
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_14.context:
CinematicNodeContext: He gave us a copy of the target list of future victims.

(Reach behind back, out of frame hand off)

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_34.speaker: Minsc
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_34.text: This one's smile distresses Boo. If it is slaughter he wants, I will give it to him directly.
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_34.context: NodeContext: Anger and distaste - a creep has just approached us asking if we want to become avatars of slaughter. Minsc wants to quickly crush his skull and move on.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_1.text: It is good to meet somebody who recognises our talents - better still if they reward us for doing what comes naturally.
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_1.context: NodeContext: pleased - the 'talents' are talents for killing

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_27.speaker: Doppelganger
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_27.text: No matter, we'll meet again. Stay safe, I hear all manner of miscreants walk the streets of our fair city.

DoppelgangerGiveQuest_33.speaker: Player
DoppelgangerGiveQuest_33.text: Sure thing - last time I got an invitation like this, life got a lot more interesting.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_2.speaker: Ludd
AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_2.text: What do you think of the wine?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_1.speaker: Koll
AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_1.text: Huh... Mine doesn't have a nose.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_4.speaker: Podd
AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_4.text: Some of these wines are remarkably light - I don't feel a thing.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_0.speaker: Koll
AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_0.text: And some of them are a de-light! Hah!

AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_6.speaker: Ludd
AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_6.text: You've had too much to drink.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_7.speaker: Koll
AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_7.text: Er... Lovely day for it, isn't it?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_9.speaker: Ludd
AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_9.text: Yes...? Isn't every day a lovely day for a drink?

AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_5.speaker: Podd
AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_5.text: You're both so uptight. Relax, have another drink!

AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_11.speaker: Koll
AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_11.text: I'm feeling a touch... woozy. I must say.

AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_10.speaker: Ludd
AD_WineFestivalChatter_001_10.text: Well, you're back to work later, so sober up, idiot.

Figaro_CivilianOutside_000_0.speaker: Varce Humbletood
Figaro_CivilianOutside_000_0.text: I really need my hair doing, so you'll have to wait in line.

Figaro_CivilianOutside_000_1.speaker: Varce Humbletood
Figaro_CivilianOutside_000_1.text: Please stop distracting me, I might miss the call for my appointment!

AD_Figaro_Doppelganger_001_FigaroClosedS.speaker: Gujj
AD_Figaro_Doppelganger_001_FigaroClosedS.text: Guessing Figaro's with a client... Making faces an' all that...

PAD_DolorEscapes_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DolorEscapes_0.text: Shit, he escaped... Going to his next victim, no doubt.

ValeriaAfterDolor_3.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_3.text: |RANDOM FLAMING FIST LEADING A NO-DEVELLA NO-VALERIA FLOW (SHORTER)|

ValeriaAfterDolor_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player takes a second to catch their breath. They've just defeated a serial killer they've been on the trail of for hours. They survey the scene, and then their attention is drawn off-stage.

ValeriaAfterDolor_50.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_50.text: Move your tiny legs faster, Devella, or they'll get away!
ValeriaAfterDolor_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see Valeria, Devella, and a small cohort of Flaming fists running towards the player.

ValeriaAfterDolor_7.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_7.text: It's all right for you, you've got bloody wings! Fists, ready weapons, prepare for - oh.
ValeriaAfterDolor_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Devella retorts to the hollyphant, before barking orders at the flaming fists, ready for combat, before she spots the player.

ValeriaAfterDolor_35.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_35.text: Oh indeed. It's you. Again. I must say - you've a real knack for sorting these things out.

ValeriaAfterDolor_52.speaker: Player
ValeriaAfterDolor_52.text: I'm just lucky I got here in time.

ValeriaAfterDolor_36.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_36.text: I'd wager the whole damn city's lucky you got here. Now, I shall inspect the -

ValeriaAfterDolor_47.speaker: Player
ValeriaAfterDolor_47.text: And you've got a real knack for missing all the action.

ValeriaAfterDolor_21.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_21.text: Say, I don't appreciate your tone. I am the Grand Investigator of the Fla-

ValeriaAfterDolor_39.speaker: Player
ValeriaAfterDolor_39.text: It's not sorted out, the killer wasn't working alone.

ValeriaAfterDolor_8.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_8.text: Not working alone? What on earth do you -

ValeriaAfterDolor_41.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_41.text: Oh dear gods. All that viscera... I'm feeling a bit q - queasy. Constable Fountainread, take point on this one. It'll be good experience.
ValeriaAfterDolor_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: the q - queasy here indicates valeria Valeria floats back at the end of this, retching

ValeriaAfterDolor_27.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_27.text: That's so gracious of you, Investigator. Sorry about that, they came straight from Sharess' Caress.
ValeriaAfterDolor_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: The last sentence is said as an aside to the player, with devella miming drinking with her hand

ValeriaAfterDolor_15.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_15.text: Solid work putting this one down. Can't have been easy. So, did you figure out why he was killing?

ValeriaAfterDolor_37.speaker: Player
ValeriaAfterDolor_37.text: Ascension. It was part of a ritual for Bhaal.

ValeriaAfterDolor_28.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_28.text: You're quite right. It seems the Lord of Murder has been busy in Baldur's Gate.

ValeriaAfterDolor_29.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_29.text: I did some digging, turns out Candulhallow's Tombstones boasts quite the sinister foot traffic these days.

ValeriaAfterDolor_2.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_2.text: Including someone matching our killer's description. Which is odd, as it's been out of business as long as I've lived here.

ValeriaAfterDolor_10.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_10.text: Y- yes, very good Devella. We suspect that's where the Bhaalist cult is situated. Whatever sick ritual they're up to must be stopped.

ValeriaAfterDolor_49.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_49.text: So, it seems there's only one thing left to do. Once you destroy this Bhaalist cult, this whole business can be put to rest.

ValeriaAfterDolor_6.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_6.text: I think the Investigator meant to say 'please'. We need your help to stop the cult.

ValeriaAfterDolor_30.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_30.text: We tried to get into Candulhallow's. The cultists we saw spoke some sort of pass phrase, but we haven't found what it is yet.

ValeriaAfterDolor_26.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_26.text: A few of them read it off a note they had - perhaps the killer you've just put down has one on his person.

ValeriaAfterDolor_24.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_24.text: You managed to stop this maniac - we couldn't even find him. Stands to reason that you're our best bet at stopping the Bhaalists.

ValeriaAfterDolor_19.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_19.text: This is fantastic news. I don't know what we'd have done if you said no.

ValeriaAfterDolor_0.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_0.text: You'd have sent me, and I'd have died a particularly stupid hero.

ValeriaAfterDolor_31.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_31.text: Well, thank Helm it didn't come to that. And, more pressingly, thank you.

ValeriaAfterDolor_12.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_12.text: I agree. Baldur's Gate lends you its gratitude today. Good luck, friend.

ValeriaAfterDolor_40.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_40.text: That's some bollocks. Without you, people will die.

ValeriaAfterDolor_17.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_17.text: Devella. Compose yourself. Look, if you change your mind, go to Candulhallows. I implore you. If not... stay safe, citizen.

ValeriaAfterDolor_38.speaker: Player
ValeriaAfterDolor_38.text: Any idea what to expect when I get there?

ValeriaAfterDolor_23.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_23.text: That's rather excellent news. Although it might not be as simple as stopping one killer.

ValeriaAfterDolor_20.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_20.text: Before you see this through, mortal - thank you. This city needs more folk like you.

ValeriaAfterDolor_1.speaker: Player
ValeriaAfterDolor_1.text: I've seen enough murder, thanks. I'm not interested.

ValeriaAfterDolor_45.speaker: Player
ValeriaAfterDolor_45.text: [EVIL PATH] But if I did that, I couldn't become an avatar of slaughter. That sounds no fun at all.

ValeriaAfterDolor_32.speaker: Player
ValeriaAfterDolor_32.text: The cult are a charming lot, I want only the best for them.

ValeriaAfterDolor_42.speaker: Valeria
ValeriaAfterDolor_42.text: What do you... Oh. Oh. You're one of them. How did I not -

ValeriaAfterDolor_16.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_16.text: FISTS! TO ME! DEFEND OUR CITY!

ValeriaAfterDolor_22.speaker: Player
ValeriaAfterDolor_22.text: He was insane, kept talking about bringing people's hands to his god.

ValeriaAfterDolor_51.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_51.text: Unfortunately, he wasn't the only one - there's a Bhaalist cult at work here.

ValeriaAfterDolor_48.speaker: Player
ValeriaAfterDolor_48.text: Everyone needs a hobby, I guess.

ValeriaAfterDolor_43.speaker: Narrator
ValeriaAfterDolor_43.text: This fellow had something a little bit more involved than a hobby.

Dolor_Soliloquy_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players enter in the room with no door at all.InternalNodeContext: NO DOOR BECAUSE PLAYERS DESTROY IT

Dolor_Soliloquy_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: If Devella is alive, she will be paralized near Dolor. Should be good if we show players that Devella is here.

Dolor_Soliloquy_27.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Soliloquy_27.text: It's unusual for prey to supply the tools of its own butchery.
Dolor_Soliloquy_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Scene] Dolor paces around a paralyzed Figaro Facemaker.

Dolor_Soliloquy_24.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Soliloquy_24.text: Razors, scissors, nail files - so many cuts one could make. And yet, such a fleeting window...
Dolor_Soliloquy_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor runs his hand across a selection of nasty looking cutting implements that a haberdasher would own

Dolor_Soliloquy_19.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Soliloquy_19.text: But then who am I to deny the auspices of destiny? For we are celebrating, Master Figaro.
Dolor_Soliloquy_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] He selects a pair of sizeable tailor's shears from the selection, weighing them up in his hand.

Dolor_Soliloquy_26.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Soliloquy_26.text: You have the delicious honour of being my crowning achievement. Your body is my ultimate gift to my lord Bhaal.
Dolor_Soliloquy_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor leans in over figaro's shoulder, almost whispering this line into his ear in a reverant, zealous, semi-sensual manner

Dolor_Soliloquy_22.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Soliloquy_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor raises the open shears towards figaro's neck

Dolor_Soliloquy_23.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Soliloquy_23.text: A challenger. My lord tests me.
Dolor_Soliloquy_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor is holding shears to Figaros throat

Dolor_Soliloquy_17.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Soliloquy_17.text: This piteous hovel will be your grave challenger.
Dolor_Soliloquy_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolar hold shears and Fiagaros throat

Dolor_Soliloquy_8.speaker: Player
Dolor_Soliloquy_8.text: 'Transcend'? This brutality is a mockery of the word.

Dolor_Soliloquy_21.speaker: Player
Dolor_Soliloquy_21.text: A paralysed victim and creepy monologue? Could you get any more cliche?

Dolor_Soliloquy_7.speaker: Player
Dolor_Soliloquy_7.text: I respect paralysing your target - makes the kill easier. But a monologue? Really?

Dolor_Soliloquy_14.speaker: Player
Dolor_Soliloquy_14.text: Enough of games. Enough hiding. You face me here and now.

Dolor_Soliloquy_10.speaker: Player
Dolor_Soliloquy_10.text: You talk too much. Come - meet your end, beast.

Dolor_Soliloquy_16.speaker: Player
Dolor_Soliloquy_16.text: A beast on the hunt is one thing - but there's only end for one gone rabid.

Dolor_Soliloquy_30.speaker: Player
Dolor_Soliloquy_30.text: I loathe cowards. Come - death is too good for the likes of you.

Dolor_Soliloquy_11.speaker: Player
Dolor_Soliloquy_11.text: You might have blades, but I am magic incarnate. You are no match for me.

Dolor_Soliloquy_28.speaker: Player
Dolor_Soliloquy_28.text: Keep to the shadows while the dwarf is distracted.

Dolor_Soliloquy_12.speaker: Player
Dolor_Soliloquy_12.text: Step softly in the nearby shadows, avoiding the dwarf's gaze.

Dolor_Soliloquy_15.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Soliloquy_15.text: You see, 'Facemaker' is a bold title to give oneself, Master Figaro...
Dolor_Soliloquy_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor traces the blade of the shears across Figaro's cheek, before pulling them back.

Dolor_Soliloquy_1.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Soliloquy_1.text: Especially when one's face can be unmade so easily.
Dolor_Soliloquy_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolor plunges the shears through the back of Figaro's head, leaving the point protruding out of his open mouth.

Dolor_Soliloquy_4.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Soliloquy_4.text: Witnesses! Sent by my lord to observe my craft.
Dolor_Soliloquy_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: {scene] Dolar holds shears to Fragaros throat

Dolor_Soliloquy_20.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_Soliloquy_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Dolar is holding shears to Figfaros throat.

Dolor_Soliloquy_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players approach from the door that is nearer from Dolor. Will see te first nodes (until the question ones) from the door.InternalNodeContext: | PLAYER ENTERS USING NEAR DOOR |

Dolor_Soliloquy_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players approach from the door that is more far from Dolor. Will see te first nodes (until the question ones) from the door.InternalNodeContext: PLAYERS ENTERS USING THE FAREST DOOR

AD_Dolor_Threat2_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_Threat2_0.text: I will savour your final breath. My last kill before becoming.

SwA_RatWitness_12.speaker: Ratin Sesescor
SwA_RatWitness_12.text: Hello, hello. Are you the new cheese-dropper? I do hope so - I'm almost down to the last crumbs.

SwA_RatWitness_13.speaker: Player
SwA_RatWitness_13.text: What happened to your last cheese-dropper?

SwA_RatWitness_5.speaker: Ratin Sesescor
SwA_RatWitness_5.text: Alexander was his name. He dropped all manner of morsels, but the cheeses were the best. Until the red man visited.

SwA_RatWitness_6.speaker: Player
SwA_RatWitness_6.text: I don't even know what a cheese-dropper is.

SwA_RatWitness_11.speaker: Ratin Sesescor
SwA_RatWitness_11.text: A person. Who drops cheese. Which I eat.
SwA_RatWitness_11.context: NodeContext: explaining as if you're talking to a simpleton

SwA_RatWitness_14.speaker: Player
SwA_RatWitness_14.text: Tell me about this 'red man' who visited Alexander.

SwA_RatWitness_10.speaker: Ratin Sesescor
SwA_RatWitness_10.text: A dwarf, all dressed in red.

SwA_RatWitness_0.speaker: Ratin Sesescor
SwA_RatWitness_0.text: He smiled and held Alexander close, and then Alexander was shouting and struggling, and soon he was all dressed in red as well.

SwA_RatWitness_19.speaker: Ratin Sesescor
SwA_RatWitness_19.text: So many red morsels fell out of Alexander. They tasted like salt and rust! Very good. Even better than cheese.

SwA_RatWitness_7.speaker: Ratin Sesescor
SwA_RatWitness_7.text: Away. To make more people red, and to spill their tasty morsels.

SwA_RatWitness_8.speaker: Ratin Sesescor
SwA_RatWitness_8.text: Go away now. Your delicious scent makes me crave your morsels, but it would be rude to bite you.

SwA_RatWitness_4.speaker: Player
SwA_RatWitness_4.text: Do you realise you ate Alexander's innards?

SwA_RatWitness_18.speaker: Ratin Sesescor
SwA_RatWitness_18.text: Yes. Tasty. He didn't need them anymore.

PAD_PoisonCheck_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PoisonCheck_0.text: This wine... It's poison. Some sort of paralytic agent.

PAD_PoisonCheck_1.speaker: Player
PAD_PoisonCheck_1.text: I recognise this wine. It's a paralysing poison...

Figaro_Doppelganger_003_0.speaker: Wobb
Figaro_Doppelganger_003_0.text: Oi, you! Get in the bloody queue!

Figaro_Doppelganger_003_1.speaker: Wobb
Figaro_Doppelganger_003_1.text: You again? Well, you can wait if you want, but don't try and cut the line!

WineFestivalCivilian005_0.speaker: Gorrka Bekoone
WineFestivalCivilian005_0.text: The wine here's good, can't say the same of the immediate company.

WineFestivalCivilian005_2.speaker: Gorrka Bekoone
WineFestivalCivilian005_2.text: I can only hope the Flaming Fist catch this killer before anyone important dies.

WineFestivalCivilian005_4.speaker: Gorrka Bekoone
WineFestivalCivilian005_4.text: I'm trying to enjoy a glass of wine. In peace. Thank you.

WineFestivalCivilian005_5.speaker: Gorrka Bekoone
WineFestivalCivilian005_5.text: Don't know about you, but I hope Lord Gortash does something to sort out public order around here.

WineFestivalCivilian005_6.speaker: Gorrka Bekoone
WineFestivalCivilian005_6.text: There was supposed to be less of this sort of thing with Lord Gortash in charge.

WineFestivalCivilian004_1.speaker: Dave Hosmo
WineFestivalCivilian004_1.text: Have you heard what those refugees have been up to? Murder and worse!

WineFestivalCivilian004_2.speaker: Dave Hosmo
WineFestivalCivilian004_2.text: See, I knew it! I knew we weren't safe!

WineFestivalCivilian004_3.speaker: Dave Hosmo
WineFestivalCivilian004_3.text: I'm amazed you're happy to just wander around here... I'd be terrified of an attack.

WineFestivalCivilian004_4.speaker: Dave Hosmo
WineFestivalCivilian004_4.text: Did you see who did it? Who they were with? Well, I have my suspicions...

PAD_PickTargetList_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PickTargetList_0.text: A list of names... Father Lorgan's on here, crossed off. A target list, perhaps?

PAD_PickTargetList_1.speaker: Player
PAD_PickTargetList_1.text: A list of names with some crossed off. Odd...

AD_WineFestivalWorkers_1.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalWorkers_1.text: I wonder if we'll get free wine again this year.

AD_WineFestivalWorkers_9.speaker: Porter Oveer
AD_WineFestivalWorkers_9.text: That wine wasn't supposed to be free. You stole it.

AD_WineFestivalWorkers_5.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalWorkers_5.text: Stealing is the best way to get things for free.

AD_WineFestivalWorkers_2.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalWorkers_2.text: How many barrels of wine will we need?

AD_WineFestivalWorkers_0.speaker: Porter Oveer
AD_WineFestivalWorkers_0.text: Enough to make the guests forget how dangerous Baldur's Gate is. So... lots.

AD_WineFestivalWorkers_4.speaker: Porter Oveer
AD_WineFestivalWorkers_4.text: Will you please keep your eyes on what you're doing?

AD_WineFestivalWorkers_6.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalWorkers_6.text: Eh? I'm trying to enjoy the festival. Stop bothering me.

AD_WineFestivalWorkers_8.speaker: Porter Oveer
AD_WineFestivalWorkers_8.text: We're not supposed to be enjoying the festival - we're working!

AD_WineFestivalWorkers_3.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalWorkers_3.text: Not drunk enough to listen to your prattle.

AD_WineFestivalWorkers_10.speaker: Porter Oveer
AD_WineFestivalWorkers_10.text: Hurry it up! We need these stalls ready sharpish.

AD_WineFestivalWorkers_7.speaker: Muttonchops Oreelly
AD_WineFestivalWorkers_7.text: You need to slow down and learn to enjoy life.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_3.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_3.text: If it had been the dwarf alone, we might have stood a chance, but these doppelgangers... they swarmed us.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_90.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_90.text: We were paralysed before we even had the chance to fight back.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_238.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_238.text: I'm glad I could keep you safe.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_189.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_189.text: And I'm glad you're fighting the fight to keep the Dread Lord out of the city.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_191.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_191.text: Weren't you supposed to be protecting patriars in the Upper City?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_241.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_241.text: I was heading that way after we last spoke, when I heard a commotion. I stepped in to see what was going on.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_77.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_77.text: Those doppelgangers are tracking his progress. Apparently this one's a rising star among Bhaalists.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_190.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_190.text: Then perhaps it's a good job I ran into him.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_87.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_87.text: Then there's more of these nutters running around... I thought as much.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_74.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_74.text: Devella Fountainhead. Constable of the Flaming Fist.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_14.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_14.text: I've been investigating the recent spate of murders across the city.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_220.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_220.text: I was on my way to the Upper City when I heard a commotion. I stepped in to see if I could help.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_64.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_64.text: It's not every day you have the chance to catch a killer in action. Not even in this profession.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_257.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_257.text: You, on the other hand, you've probably seen your fair share of murders since you discovered your heritage.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_223.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_223.text: The assailant is dead now. But I overheard some of his plans.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_113.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_113.text: We can question the assailant later, once he comes round, but I think I have it now.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_255.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_255.text: It offers access to the 'tribunal'. An initiation rite, held by your Father's acolytes, that brings a new cultist into the fold.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_246.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_246.text: Perhaps they've even asked you to undertake this gruesome sacrament.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_76.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_76.text: I have a hand - I plan to infiltrate the tribunal and tear it down from within.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_99.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_99.text: I must find a hand, so I can infiltrate the tribunal and tear it down from within.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_57.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_57.text: You're brave, spawn, to put yourself into the heart of the Hells like that. Braver than us all.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_106.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_106.text: But you're just one sword against a god - are you sure you're up to it?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_24.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_24.text: I can't keep running from Bhaal forever - I must sever his hold, once and for all.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_44.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_44.text: It won't be easy, but I'm glad to hear your conviction.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_181.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_181.text: I am in command. Even Bhaal will bow to me eventually.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_207.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_207.text: I'm not sure I can be free, but I will do what's right until the end.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_6.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_6.text: A word of advice, then, if I may.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_94.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_94.text: Infiltrate the cult. Deceive your Father's lackeys. If Bhaal believes he has you, they will let down their guard.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_105.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_105.text: There's bound to be one moment where he trips up, and you see a way to stand against him.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_46.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_46.text: I don't know what will happen to the Gate if you don't, but I do know that you're damn well the best hope we have.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_253.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_253.text: In the meantime, I'm going to Basilisk Gate. I'll try to drum up some support - and warn as many important people as possible. Hope I can yell loud enough.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_132.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_132.text: When I see you there, Devella, this will all be over.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_126.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_126.text: Thank you for believing in me.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_143.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_143.text: See you around, Bhaalspawn. Stay alive for me, won't you?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_72.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_72.text: You're not going to join me?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_183.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_183.text: I'd love to. To be among the minds of the madmen first-hand... But there's not a chance I'd pass.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_122.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_122.text: I wish the Fist could do more. You're useless.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_140.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_140.text: I deserve that one. Detective-in-distress, and all. But I will keep trying.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_254.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_254.text: I really don't know if I'm up to it...

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_97.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_97.text: I don't know where 'Candulhallow's Tombstones' is.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_93.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_93.text: You have to try to find it and stop the cult. Not for me. For the Baldurians.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_83.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_83.text: I think they will want to make me leader of their cult very soon.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_28.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_28.text: I gravely hope you mean to dismantle it, and this friendship won't end with crossed swords.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_159.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_159.text: I'm staying away from Bhaal. I never wanted any part in this.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_75.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_75.text: Perhaps you will keep your life if you stay away. If you think you can run from Bhaal, I won't blame you.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_195.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_195.text: Then I must doubly warn the patriars if he is soon to lash out at them. I'll be in Basilisk Gate if ever you need.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_50.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_50.text: These killings aren't random. In fact, they seem to be part of some sort of test.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_177.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_177.text: That document you showed me before - the one with the victims' names on it - that was the briefing.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_92.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_92.text: The killers paralyse their victims, take their hands as an offering for Bhaal, and make it look like the cult of the Absolute was behind it all.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_81.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_81.text: It grants them access to a 'tribunal'. From what I could gather, it's some sort of rite of initiation for aspiring cultists to prove their worth.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_16.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_16.text: And it's taking place beneath 'Candulhallow's Tombstones'.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_61.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_61.text: Like I said before, it's not something I can look into in an official capacity, but you...

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_256.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_256.text: I have a hand. I'll investigate this tribunal.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_37.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_37.text: How did you...? Perhaps it's best I don't ask. Do what you have to do.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_226.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_226.text: I suppose I'd better go and find a hand, then.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_235.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_235.text: Technically, I haven't yet done an inventory of this crime scene, so if something were to go 'missing' from a corpse...
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_235.context: NodeContext: suggestive - she's implying you should loot the corpse of the murderer

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_152.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_152.text: 'Candulhallow's Tombstones' - any idea where that is?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_47.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_47.text: It's not a place I'd ever heard of, if I'm honest. But rumour has it there were some hidden cellars somewhere near the Elfsong.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_65.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_65.text: Sounds like you have a lot to follow up on. I'll leave you to it.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_225.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_225.text: I will, but I'm still obliged to protect the Upper City patriars first.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_59.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_59.text: I'll take a look into it.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_151.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_151.text: And I'll pick up where I left off - the Upper City.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_110.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_110.text: When I'm done, I'll stop by the Basilisk Gate. If you've got anything to tell of your investigations by then, I'd love to hear it.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_150.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_150.text: Now if you don't mind, I need to draft a report to my superiors before I forget it all. But don't worry, I'll be sure to put in a good word for you.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_128.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_128.text: I know that the murders are connected to Bhaal, if that's what you overheard.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_251.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_251.text: Don't panic, but I'm sort of... his spawn.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_78.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_78.text: Oh! Oh my. By Ilmater's rack, that's... that's...

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_56.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_56.text: I should arrest you at once, but - well, the Bhaalspawn crisis, it's the most interesting criminal plight in Baldurian history.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_79.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_79.text: If what you claim is true, you wouldn't be helping me here unless you were trying to end Bhaal's hold over you.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_138.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_138.text: Just like the wayward Bhaalspawn who saved the Gate before...

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_252.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_252.text: You are here to help me, and not to sacrifice me, aren't you?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_243.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_243.text: You're very excited about Bhaal for someone who's supposed to be protecting the city.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_41.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_41.text: It's my job to be. Though I confess it has been very interesting.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_230.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_230.text: You see, these murders have been cropping up all over the city. I've been following their trail for a while now, and tracing it back to its roots.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_227.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_227.text: They're always the same - victim paralysed by poison, Absolutist symbol scrawled on the floor in blood. Hand removed pre-mortem.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_40.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_40.text: The ritualistic brutality of them... it's extraordinary. And it could only be the work of a Bhaalist.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_172.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_172.text: But you've been investigating too, if I'm not mistaken? You're trying to stop your own kind?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_163.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_163.text: I am working against Bhaal - I got a hold of the list of murder targets.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_88.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_88.text: I'm glad you're on the right side of this, Bhaalspawn. You could be invaluable, if you can get on the inside.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_107.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_107.text: Hells, you might be the only one who can stop this. What else do you know?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_249.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_249.text: I was hoping you could tell me more.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_118.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_118.text: I'm planning to infiltrate the cult, but I don't know where to start.
