Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_20.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_20.text: Most of what I know is based on reading into Sarevok's history. I'm sure it's nothing next to your personal experience, but I'll share what I have.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_114.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_114.text: A century ago, Bhaal bred dozens just like you. One of whom was Sarevok Anchev.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_186.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_186.text: Bhaal is trying to force me to be his Chosen. I'm doing all I can to resist him.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_12.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_12.text: Father has shown me visions - the Temple of Bhaal lurks somewhere in the city.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_104.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_104.text: So it's all happening again... just like in Sarevok's time...

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_174.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_174.text: I don't know much. I only just found out I was a Bhaalspawn in a vision.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_158.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_158.text: You've had a busy tenday. I can't even imagine. Here's what I know.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_215.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_215.text: I'm working against Bhaal - I found the murderer's target list.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_34.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_34.text: Tell her of the target list. Say nothing of your intentions.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_63.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_63.text: Show her the target list. Say nothing of your intentions.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_67.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_67.text: I am here to sacrifice you, I'm afraid.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_139.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_139.text: Ah, hells. I will live to warn the Gate. FISTS!

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_175.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_175.text: You tell me what you know, and I'll tell you what I know.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_212.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_212.text: There's no way in the hells that those scenes and these murders aren't connected somehow.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_204.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_204.text: Now your turn. What do you know about the killings?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_211.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_211.text: Show her the murder target list.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_43.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_43.text: Gods... This is it. The proof that I was right!
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Devella takes and studies the murder target list.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_247.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_247.text: I've been working on an assignment, see - a research project of sorts. I knew my conclusions were sound, but this... I never expected this.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_131.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_131.text: I'll tell you what I know.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_18.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_18.text: A century ago, there was a child of the god of murder - Sarevok Anchev.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_121.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_121.text: He ruled the Iron Throne - a dark tower hiding a darker secret. It was the front for a deadly arms-dealing network.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_210.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_210.text: There, he amassed an army, seeking to become a god himself. Under his stewardship, the Bhaal Temple was revived, and with it, the Bhaal cult itself.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_208.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_208.text: Fortunately, the Temple was destroyed, and to cleanse the city of Sarevok's memory, the Iron Throne was torn from its foundations and cast into the Chionthar.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_229.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_229.text: For most, that was the end of it. But cults like that don't disappear overnight. This list you brought me confirms I'm right.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_33.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_33.text: For most, that was the end of it. But cults like that don't disappear overnight.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_31.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_31.text: The Bhaal cult is back, and someone is out there, continuing Sarevok's work.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_102.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_102.text: Bhaal has a new Chosen in Baldur's Gate - Orin. I suspect she's behind this.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_205.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_205.text: I think it may be a Bhaalspawn...

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_17.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_17.text: I think it may be another Bhaalspawn...

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_100.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_100.text: Gods save us all if you're right, but I'd believe it. Whoever it is, they are intimately familiar with Sarevok's work.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_115.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_115.text: What makes you think it's not Sarevok himself?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_127.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_127.text: I've not ruled out the possibility that it is Sarevok himself.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_221.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_221.text: The brutality of the killings is certainly reminiscent of his work. But there's something more here, something new...

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_196.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_196.text: No idea, unfortunately. But whoever it is, they are intimately familiar with Sarevok's work.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_119.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_119.text: You said Sarevok led the cultists a century ago - he can't still be alive, can he?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_55.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_55.text: Stranger things have come back to haunt this city.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_167.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_167.text: You're not wrong about the cult. I found some Bhaalists in the sewers.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_29.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_29.text: No doubt you found a trail of bodies in their wake?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_133.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_133.text: The brutality of the killings is on a par with Sarevok's own. But there's something more here, something new...

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_45.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_45.text: There's a reverence to these murders, a certain flair. It's as if they were done in worship.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_176.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_176.text: The precision of the cuts, the depth, the execution - the best butchers in Faerûn couldn't make a cut like that. Trust me, I've asked them.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_7.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_7.text: I tried to explain all this to my superiors, but they wouldn't have any of it.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_148.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_148.text: They told me to drop it. Told me the city doesn't need another conspiracy theorist and to get back to doing my job before they find someone else to do it for me.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_103.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_103.text: But you - you're not bound by such constraints. Help me out, here. Help the city out.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_250.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_250.text: Follow the trail of these murders. Prove the truth. Use your lineage to get places the Fist can't.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_178.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_178.text: I'll bet if you follow the trail of these murders, you'll be able to unearth the truth of this resurgence.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_49.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_49.text: I'm going to stop my Father, whatever it takes.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_232.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_232.text: If anyone can, it will be you. Or at least that's what the legends say.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_21.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_21.text: Believe me, I wish I could. But I need this job.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_231.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_231.text: Half the silkroot-chewers in the Gate have claimed to be a Bhaalspawn at one point. The Fist don't listen to ghost stories.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_147.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_147.text: You're better off not raising any suspicions. Trust me.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_149.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_149.text: What will you do in the meantime?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_10.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_10.text: Try to convince my superiors to put some resources into this matter.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_42.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_42.text: After what's happened here, they might finally take this seriously. Might.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_244.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_244.text: I'm trying to hide from my Father's wrath. I fear what will happen if I delve too deeply.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_111.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_111.text: Then I hope you can at least protect yourself, and pray this plot fails.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_15.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_15.text: Meet me at Basilisk Gate if you've anything more to report. And good luck.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_146.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_146.text: I've got better things to do than investigate a cult.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_213.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_213.text: I suppose it was quite an ask... I'll see if I can drum up some support from Basilisk Gate.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_58.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_58.text: Meet me there if you have a change of heart.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_166.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_166.text: I've done everything I can within the remit of my job. Any more, and they'll fire me.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_187.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_187.text: Not only is the cult back, it's spreading fast. I ran into some Bhaalists in the park.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_27.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_27.text: You should raise this with your superiors, immediately.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_82.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_82.text: Don't you think I've tried? They won't listen.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_224.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_224.text: You're lucky you met me - most of the Fist wouldn't have believed you were a Bhaalspawn. Think it's Baldurian superstition.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_23.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_23.text: Tell her about the murder target list you found.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_217.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_217.text: Gods - that's it! Proof that I was right.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_112.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_112.text: I killed Bhaal's second favourite child, Orin.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_202.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_202.text: So the Bhaalists had a new leader, and you killed them...

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_117.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_117.text: This is excellent news. Though - perhaps not as excellent as you might imagine.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_171.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_171.text: You see, when one cult leader is ousted, all that does is leave a vacuum for the next one to step in.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_70.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_70.text: My best guess says it's whoever runs the tribunal - a Bhaalist ritual of initiation. It's all Dolor could talk about.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_180.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_180.text: Let me guess - you want me to investigate.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_66.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_66.text: If it were up to me, I'd have every Fist in the city on this.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_173.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_173.text: The dwarf mentioned somewhere called 'Candulhallow's Tombstones'. But I can't even look into it... not without getting fired.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_192.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_192.text: Where can I find this tribunal?

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_240.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_240.text: The dwarf mentioned somewhere called 'Candulhallow's Tombstones'.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_198.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_198.text: I would look into it myself... if it wouldn't get me fired.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_216.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_216.text: You see, I already reported this to my superiors, but they wouldn't have any of it.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_51.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_51.text: You need to put a stop to this.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_125.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_125.text: Oh believe me, I would love to. If it wouldn't get me fired.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_69.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_69.text: The vacuum has already been filled - I am Bhaal's new Chosen.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_68.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_68.text: I'm one of the killers trying to become an Unholy Assassin.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_144.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_144.text: I'm just a civilian. Forget I said anything.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_9.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_9.text: You're a terrible liar. You've got something. Give it here.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_11.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_11.text: You're a terrible liar. Tell me everything - now.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_153.speaker: Narrator
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_153.text: *Begrudgingly, you tell her about the murder target list you found.*

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_197.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_197.text: Shame. I really thought you might... have something. But you're right, civilians shouldn't be involved in crime scenes.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_19.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_19.text: Now if you don't mind, I've an autopsy to request, and a family to inform.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_206.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_206.text: Though you did save my life. So - thanks.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_260.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_260.text: Tell me what you know. You owe me - I just saved your life.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_200.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_200.text: Tell me what you heard or the next murder victim will be you.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_137.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_137.text: If I had a coin for every time a civilian threatened me...
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_137.context: NodeContext: weary - she's seen this shit before

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_234.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_234.text: You've seen those gruesome dioramas that have been springing up, right? Corpses posed like unholy paintings, blood everywhere...

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_264.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_264.text: There's no way in the hells that those scenes and these murders aren't connected, and I think I know what the connection is.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_258.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_258.text: Listen, I'm grateful that you saved my life. But you really shouldn't have had to. It's my job to keep you safe, not the other way around. Now if you don't mind, I'd like to get back to it.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_242.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_242.text: Good thing I was here to save you, then.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_48.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_48.text: As if I didn't have enough reason to thank you already.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_32.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_32.text: Awful. I'm sure you've a lot of paperwork to do. I'll leave you to it.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_39.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_39.text: Wait! I think you'll want to hear what I have to say.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_8.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_8.text: You're not wrong there. Never thought I'd have my life saved by a civilian - thank you.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_170.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_170.text: And Figaro... I'll let the family know.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_261.speaker: Player
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_261.text: I wasn't going to let Dolor kill you. Your life is mine.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_120.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_120.text: So this is Bhaal's cruelty... I underestimated it.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_60.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_60.text: I can't believe I'm glad to see a Bhaalspawn, but gods, I knew you'd be the one to stop this.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_80.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_80.text: I should've known it would be you. Thank you.

Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_219.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
Figaro_Devella_AfterParalysis_219.text: I don't know who you are, but I'm glad you were there.

RefugeeChild_001_14.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_14.text: Have you seen him? Have you seen my dad?

RefugeeChild_001_3.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_3.text: His name is Jacek, he's a super brave knight.

RefugeeChild_001_16.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_16.text: We came here together, but he had to leave. He said that Cora would look after me.

RefugeeChild_001_8.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_8.text: She's really nice, but... I miss dad.

RefugeeChild_001_12.speaker: Narrator
RefugeeChild_001_12.text: *There's a sadness in her voice that betrays a wisdom beyond her years - she knows her father's not coming back.*

RefugeeChild_001_26.speaker: Halsin
RefugeeChild_001_26.text: What use are city walls if the people within them must still live in fear...?

RefugeeChild_001_11.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_11.text: The lady over there. She smells of lavender and roses. She's really nice.

RefugeeChild_001_29.speaker: Player
RefugeeChild_001_29.text: Has Cora been looking after you like your dad said?

RefugeeChild_001_6.speaker: Player
RefugeeChild_001_6.text: Your dad sounds like a good man.

RefugeeChild_001_21.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_21.text: He is. I miss him. But I'm glad he left me with Cora. She's really nice.

RefugeeChild_001_10.speaker: Player
RefugeeChild_001_10.text: I'm sorry. It's not easy to lose someone you love.

RefugeeChild_001_4.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_4.text: Has it happened to you, too? I'm sorry. It's the worst.

RefugeeChild_001_2.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_2.text: Perhaps Cora can look after you, too?

RefugeeChild_001_28.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_28.text: She looks after all the kids who've got nowhere to go.

RefugeeChild_001_20.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_20.text: She's helping me write down all of my dad's stories so everyone will know how brave he is.

RefugeeChild_001_17.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_17.text: I'm not stupid, but but - you didn't have to be so mean!

RefugeeChild_001_24.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_24.text: I've been telling Cora everything me and dad did. We're going to write the best book ever.

RefugeeChild_001_23.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_23.text: Dad will be so proud of me.

RefugeeChild_001_27.speaker: Molly the Orphan
RefugeeChild_001_27.text: Thank you for helping Cora. I couldn't do any of this without her.

Figaro_CivilianOutside_001_0.speaker: Hannaah Befling
Figaro_CivilianOutside_001_0.text: I wouldn't hold your breath if you're here to see Figaro.

Figaro_CivilianOutside_001_1.speaker: Hannaah Befling
Figaro_CivilianOutside_001_1.text: This Figaro fellow must be good if his appointments take this long.

WineFestivalWorker01_0.speaker: Porter Oveer
WineFestivalWorker01_0.text: Shhh. Keep it down, I'm trying to listen to the Fists. I need to see if I can start packing up yet.

WineFestivalWorker01_1.speaker: Porter Oveer
WineFestivalWorker01_1.text: You see, the key is to have enough drink to be cheery, but not so much you fall over.

WineFestivalWorker01_2.speaker: Porter Oveer
WineFestivalWorker01_2.text: Please do not distract me, I've got so many wine barrels to move. So many.

WineFestivalWorker01_3.speaker: Porter Oveer
WineFestivalWorker01_3.text: Don't you be messing with my setup, now.

WineFestivalWorker01_4.speaker: Porter Oveer
WineFestivalWorker01_4.text: Did you see the bloke who ran through here? Either mad or drunk. Maybe both.

WineFestivalWorker01_5.speaker: Porter Oveer
WineFestivalWorker01_5.text: It seems a bit distasteful to ask, but when do you think I should start taking the stalls down?

WineFestivalWorker01_6.speaker: Porter Oveer
WineFestivalWorker01_6.text: Now, keep it quiet, but I'm thinking I might have a little work tipple.

PAD_InteractWineCart_0.speaker: Player
PAD_InteractWineCart_0.text: | A Wine seller cart. Maybe is inside the house selling wine |

PAD_InteractWineCart_1.speaker: Player
PAD_InteractWineCart_1.text: | That smell... Smells exactly the Karabasan's Gift! |

SwD_FrancPeartree_25.speaker: Narrator
SwD_FrancPeartree_25.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

SwD_FrancPeartree_18.speaker: Franc Peartree
SwD_FrancPeartree_18.text: Limbs... locked up... then hand... cut off...

SwD_FrancPeartree_14.speaker: Player
SwD_FrancPeartree_14.text: What did your killer look like?

SwD_FrancPeartree_1.speaker: Player
SwD_FrancPeartree_1.text: What were you doing when you died?

SwD_FrancPeartree_7.speaker: Narrator
SwD_FrancPeartree_7.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

SwD_FrancPeartree_29.speaker: Narrator
SwD_FrancPeartree_29.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

SwD_FrancPeartree_31.speaker: Narrator
SwD_FrancPeartree_31.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Figaro_SwD_18.speaker: Narrator
Figaro_SwD_18.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Figaro_SwD_22.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
Figaro_SwD_22.text: A dwarf... dressed in red... Death in his... eyes...

Figaro_SwD_1.speaker: Player
Figaro_SwD_1.text: What were you doing when you died?

Figaro_SwD_10.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
Figaro_SwD_10.text: Seeing a... customer... called himself... Dolor...

Figaro_SwD_3.speaker: Narrator
Figaro_SwD_3.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Figaro_SwD_21.speaker: Narrator
Figaro_SwD_21.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Figaro_SwD_23.speaker: Narrator
Figaro_SwD_23.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

WineFestivalCivilian003_0.speaker: Aran Elomar
WineFestivalCivilian003_0.text: Did you hear that dwarf shouting earlier? How uncouth.

WineFestivalCivilian003_1.speaker: Aran Elomar
WineFestivalCivilian003_1.text: Look, I was being polite before. I would just rather not speak with you.

WineFestivalCivilian003_3.speaker: Aran Elomar
WineFestivalCivilian003_3.text: How terrible... I think he knocked over some bottles in the fray.

WineFestivalCivilian003_4.speaker: Aran Elomar
WineFestivalCivilian003_4.text: I'm afraid I can't talk, I need to focus on this wine... It's rather complex.

Figaro_AD_CivilianOutside_001_0.speaker: Hannaah Befling
Figaro_AD_CivilianOutside_001_0.text: No way to run a business I say - can't even browse while he's with a client.

Doppelganger_000_0.speaker: Koll
Doppelganger_000_0.text: If you've not tried Master Meztli's wines yet, I hear they're lovely.

Doppelganger_000_1.speaker: Koll
Doppelganger_000_1.text: I prefer something a touch darker than the fare on offer here, to be honest.

Ontur_0.speaker: Ontur
Ontur_0.text: I can't believe someone would do such a thing...

Ontur_1.speaker: Ontur
Ontur_1.text: We might all need something rather stronger than wine to steady our nerves.

Ontur_2.speaker: Ontur
Ontur_2.text: You're the saviour of the festival - barely a drop of blood or wine spilled!

Ontur_3.speaker: Ontur
Ontur_3.text: Glorious summer day, is it not? Perfect, in my opinion, for a light, refreshing tipple!

Ontur_4.speaker: Ontur
Ontur_4.text: Awful, awful business, this murder. Terrible stuff.

Ontur_5.speaker: Ontur
Ontur_5.text: Ah, you return! Beautiful day for a bottle.

Flaerith_0.speaker: Flaerith
Flaerith_0.text: Meztli? A killer? I knew he didn't belong among such fine company.

Flaerith_1.speaker: Flaerith
Flaerith_1.text: There's some rather lovely vintages out today - I'd get in quick if I were you.

Flaerith_2.speaker: Flaerith
Flaerith_2.text: It's terrible... I can't believe they've called off the festival. Oh - and the killings too, of course. Just awful.

Flaerith_3.speaker: Flaerith
Flaerith_3.text: Back again, I see. Hope you're enjoying the festivities.

Flaerith_4.speaker: Flaerith
Flaerith_4.text: Dreadful news all around. I can only hope they'll reschedule the festival - I was rather looking forward to it.

Flaerith_5.speaker: Flaerith
Flaerith_5.text: Just goes to show - you can never trust a fellow who sells pink wine.

Figaro_AD_Doppelganger_003_0.speaker: Wobb
Figaro_AD_Doppelganger_003_0.text: Gods, Master Figaro must be dilligent to spend so long with a client.

Doppelganger_001_0.speaker: Ludd
Doppelganger_001_0.text: If you'll excuse me, I have some wine to attend to.

Doppelganger_001_1.speaker: Ludd
Doppelganger_001_1.text: A fine festival indeed, wouldn't you say?

WineFestivalCivilian002_0.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
WineFestivalCivilian002_0.text: You can almost forget there's a war coming, can't you?

WineFestivalCivilian002_1.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
WineFestivalCivilian002_1.text: They looked so content together... How could someone... Gods.

WineFestivalCivilian002_3.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
WineFestivalCivilian002_3.text: I was rather enjoying this festival until all that horrible shouting about sacrifices.

WineFestivalCivilian002_4.speaker: Jaycen Borgu
WineFestivalCivilian002_4.text: You know, festivals like this give me a bit of hope. Everyone's so happy.

AD_RefugeeChild_001_0.speaker: Molly the Orphan
AD_RefugeeChild_001_0.text: Why don't they let us have any wine? It's just grape juice isn't it?

AD_RefugeeChild_001_1.speaker: Molly the Orphan
AD_RefugeeChild_001_1.text: I hope dad remembers the address...

AD_RefugeeChild_001_3.speaker: Molly the Orphan
AD_RefugeeChild_001_3.text: Why would anyone want to hurt Cora?
